Stem: Wiry, green, branching frequently, flattened sterms form psuedo leaves.
Leaves: Reduced, scale-like, their function replaced by flattened stems 5-15 mm long, curved and oval-shaped.
Flowers: White, solitary or few per cluster, stalked 3-8 mm with 6 petals.
Habitat: Open coastal woodland, also orchards and roadsides.
DistinguishingFeatures: Leaves can have similar appearance to native Wombat Berry, but flowers and fruit are distinctive.

Photos.Caption: Leaves yellow for winter, red berries
Forms curtains of foliage on tree trunks
